headline: EM Currencies Steady as USD Loses Haven Appeal
summary: The MSCI benchmark for EM currencies recovered from losses during the trading session and closed flat while the dollar slipped 0.1%.  Currencies from Colombia and Brazil climbed, shrugging off early morning’s weakness.  “EM currencies are back on the gaining trend established last year,” said Juan Perez, senior director of trading at Monex USA.

content.title: EM Currencies Steady as USD Loses Haven Appeal
content.summary: The MSCI benchmark for EM currencies recovered from losses during the trading session and closed flat while the dollar slipped 0.1%.  Currencies from Colombia and Brazil climbed, shrugging off early morning’s weakness.  “EM currencies are back on the gaining trend established last year,” said Juan Perez, senior director of trading at Monex USA.

headline: Nvidia’s $4 Trillion Stock Rally Faces More Threats Than Ever
summary: Nvidia Corp. shares are down 9.1% since hitting a record on Oct. 29, well underperforming the S&P 500 Index, as investors grow concerned about the sustainability of artificial intelligence spending and the chip giant’s grip on the market.  The recent drop is notable considering that on the day the stock last closed at an all-time high, it was up more than 1,300% since the end of 2022 and Nvidia’s market capitalization was over $5 trillion compared with roughly $400 billion less than three years earlier.  Meanwhile, the dominant AI chipmaker is facing more competition than ever before from rivals like Advanced Micro Devices Inc., as well as its biggest clients, including Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. And Wall Street is growing increasingly worried about Nvidia’s investments in many of its customers, which could be seen as artificially propping up demand.

content.title: Nvidia’s $4 Trillion Stock Rally Faces More Threats Than Ever
content.summary: Nvidia Corp. shares are down 9.1% since hitting a record on Oct. 29, well underperforming the S&P 500 Index, as investors grow concerned about the sustainability of artificial intelligence spending and the chip giant’s grip on the market.  The recent drop is notable considering that on the day the stock last closed at an all-time high, it was up more than 1,300% since the end of 2022 and Nvidia’s market capitalization was over $5 trillion compared with roughly $400 billion less than three years earlier.  Meanwhile, the dominant AI chipmaker is facing more competition than ever before from rivals like Advanced Micro Devices Inc., as well as its biggest clients, including Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. And Wall Street is growing increasingly worried about Nvidia’s investments in many of its customers, which could be seen as artificially propping up demand.

headline: 3 Stocks Under $50 We Think Twice About
summary: Stocks trading between $10 and $50 can be particularly interesting as they frequently represent businesses that have survived their early challenges. However, investors should remain vigilant as some may still have unproven business models, leaving them vulnerable to the ebbs and flows of the broader market.

headline: Why Amazon’s Spending Spree Makes It a Must-Buy Now
summary: For investors in Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN), 2025 proved to be a lackluster year. The stock only rose about 5%, trailing the S&P 500‘s 16% advance and also lagging most of its Magnificent 7 peers, including Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), which gained just 8%. This underperformance stemmed from concerns over Amazon’s heavy capital spending and slowing cash flow generation. ... Why Amazon’s Spending Spree Makes It a Must-Buy Now

headline: Wall Street rises on Big Tech gains and approaches records
summary: Stocks rose on Wall Street Tuesday morning and approached more all-time highs.  Big technology companies were behind much of the market's gains.  Nvidia jumped 1.5% and was the biggest single force behind the market's gains.

content.title: Wall Street rises on Big Tech gains and approaches records
